channel.description: Recent content in Finance on Techiedeepdive

item.title: Irish tax calculation using Python Jupyter notebook
item.description:
For few years now I have using google sheets to keep track of taxes and check payroll tax calculations (trust but verify, Right?). Anyway, I decided to move to Jupyter notebook/python combo to do the calculations. This is small code to calculate the Irish tax (PAYE, USC, PRSI). I have a bigger dashboard with ESPP, RSU and bonus but I thought it would be an overkill here.

Jupyter Link to heading

To start a Jupyter notebook:

item.title: Ireland Rental Price Analysis
item.description:
While the world is on fire, I wanted something light to do to get my mind off the news. So, I decided to look at another crisis. Ireland Housing Crisis :)

Anyone who is familiar with Ireland knows about the housing shortage. So, Like everyone here, I check daft on daily basis(several times a day actually).

I thought it would be fun to scrap Daft.ie and do basic analysis on the data(nothing fancy!). I am using jupyter notebooks because as all the cool kids use it :)

item.title: Stock Market Definitions
item.description:
52 week Range Link to heading

invest Define it as

The 52-week range is a data point traditionally reported by printed financial news media, but more modernly included in data feeds from financial information sources online. The data point includes the lowest and highest price at which a stock has traded during the previous 52 weeks.

Volume Link to heading

Volume is the amount of an asset or security that changes hands over some period of time, often over the course of a day.
